oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Songwriters Salute Hank Williams - 2011-04-16
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: I Saw The Light: Songwriters Salute Hank Williams featuring Rodney Crowell; Ashley Monroe; The Secret Sisters; Steve Young from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 16, 2011. Companion to the Hank Williams Family Tradition exhibit.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: The Secret Sisters; Ashley Monroe; Rodney Crowell; Steve Young;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Performances include; Why Don't You Love Me; Your Cheating Heart; River Jordan; House Of Gold (The Secret Sisters); Hank's Cadillac; unidentified song likely I Don't Know Why I Do The Things I Do; I Saw The Light; If I Die A'Drinkin' (Ashley Monroe); Unidentified Song; Ramblin' Man; Montgomery In The Rain; Long Way To Hollywood (Steve Young); Wedding Bells; Reading From Chinaberry Sidewalks; I Hope You Shed A Million Tears; Jambalaya (On The Bayou) (with Ashley Monroe and Hilary Williams); Cold, Cold Heart (Rodney Crowell);
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; the Secret Sisters (Musical group); Monroe, Ashley; Crowell, Rodney; Young, Steve; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
